intro: Callianthe schenckii, commonly known as the Schenck's ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in well-drained environments. Its flowers are often pink or purple and attract specific pollinators such as moths and flies. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
